tweet_text: @FeldAryeh Thanks for clarifying! You'll want to save the PaymentIntent ID to your own database and associate it with the order (you can also add metadata to the PaymentIntent). You can then listen for the payment_intent.succeeded event. You may find this helpful: https://t.co/Pxa2qHvghS

@workingjubilee @SilverEagleDev @mitch_hots We're so sorry that this has happened. It's the cardholder's right to issue a chargeback, even in the case of donations. 3D Secure is an effective means of preventing fraudulent chargebacks, but you'd need to speak with ko-fi to find out if it can be enabled on their platform.

@jackmcdade Thanks for this context, Jackâ€”this helps. We're going to take a peek into your feedback a bit further. For the second half of your feedback around webhooks, would you mind sharing what types of events you're looking to test as well?

@Argentor_ We're really sorry to hear that you received a disputeâ€”unfortunately, we don't control the outcome of when one is placed. We have some tips on responding to disputes here: https://t.co/EE4qzxhzwj, and also have some additional tips on how to prevent them: https://t.co/LCyvkZlYc7

@MathieuDGO Sorry to see that you were hit with a dispute. Unfortunately, we don't have control over the outcome but we can help you prevent them and advise you on how best to respond to them. Feel free to send us an email via https://t.co/tcqnwTHWUW and we'll be happy to help.
@petjato Unfortunately, this isn't possibleâ€”events arenâ€™t available for longer than 30 days (while other historical objects are), sorry! https://t.co/7Lhcca7TmT
@CupcakeCornerUK We suggest reaching out to Eventbrite directlyâ€”they'll be best able to help you with this.

@kabandisaikia ðŸ‘‹ Hey Kabandiâ€”you can achieve these types of notifications through the use of custom webhooks and listening for subscription events. We have a bit more on this here: https://t.co/fvqYf8QFy8.
@fredbradley Not at the moment, unfortunately. You can view a timeline of events using `/v1/events`, but this doesn't include notes (eg. "Intake full"), which are Dashboard-only.

@NadtakanF For Connect, both live and test webhooks will be sent to your production URLsâ€”we recommend checking the livemode value when receiving an event webhook to know what action should be taken. https://t.co/RdLMa3LGVY,  https://t.co/HuDltoXf0d

@gerardnll ðŸ‘‹ It sounds like you're correctly using a live mode Connect account with your test mode keys. Your live mode Connect webhook endpoints can receive both live and test events.  Using the 'livemode' value can help identify each. We have more on this here: https://t.co/RdLMa3LGVY.

@milos_djekic 3D Secure not only helps to prevent genuinely fraudulent transactionsâ€”it shifts liability to the card issuer, which means that you will not be deducted funds regardless of the whether or not the transaction is legitimate: https://t.co/8B2z4bjGCv

@romansorinn ðŸ‘‹ Hey thereâ€”we have a few tips on what to do if Stripe emails aren't coming to you (or are ending up in a filter): https://t.co/tfaWY7hBvp. You may be able to adjust your filter settings to prevent this.

@g_silverfox We're so sorry that you've been hit with another dispute. There are measures you can take to help prevent fraudulent disputes from happening (most notably using 3D Secure and Chargeback Protection). We'd love to talk you through these in detail if you'd like to send us a DM?

@Jaspind07199761 ðŸ‘‹ Looks like each duplicate charge was taken a few minutes apart, which suggests that the customers may have clicked twice on the payment page (possibly because the page was lagging). You can use idempotency keys to prevent duplicate charges in future: https://t.co/mf3VQLXFNt
@Evanish You could add your own tracking for this using webhook events to listen for changes in subscriptions and cancellations. You might find https://t.co/VaTCh1PGXq helpful!
@lukeredpath Hm, nothing that we're aware of at this timeâ€”mind sharing a bit more about what events you're running into issues with?

@billxinli You'd be able to listen to changes to 'metadata' with webhooks whenever a .created or .updated event occurs. If you were to update a customer in the Dashboard for example, you could listen to customer.updated for any changes to metadata that occur.

@Gtway2Morocco We're sorry to hear this was the outcome. The dispute process, including the outcome of a dispute, is managed by the bank: https://t.co/zbAaxlBtjt. 

While the outcome can't be changed, you might be able to prevent this in the future: https://t.co/LCyvkZlYc7.
@MrWeijland For Express and Custom accounts, it's the platform which is debited in the event of a negative balance: https://t.co/O1OS02ptoY

@winnerscirclefc ðŸ˜” We're sorry this happened. We understand how impactful this is to your business, especially if charges are legitimate. While we can't change what happened, we'd encourage you to look at some of our tips on fraud prevention and disputes we have here: https://t.co/LCyvkZ4mNx.

@Threepwood10 Thanks for sharing thatâ€”since it's isolated to one computer, it could likely be a firewall or third-party plugin preventing the page from loading. We'd recommend looking at your firewall settings, and checking to see if there are any plugins that could be a factor here.

@hegemonster If you use webhooks to listen for the 'charge.refund.updated' event to occur, you'll be able to see this. These refunds statuses also exist in the refund object: https://t.co/f65zPUFnHS with a status of 'failed'.

@hegemonster If you use webhooks to listen for the 'charge.refund.updated' event to occur, you'll be able to see this. These refunds statuses also exist in the refund object: https://t.co/f65zPUFnHS with a status of 'failed'.
